<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/24/wework-cofounder-neumann-steps?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Neumann’s no Longer a Royal We
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Neumann’s no Longer a Royal We" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY5MzYxMDYyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Adam Neumann is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/24/wework-ceo-adam-neumann-is-expected-to-step-down-amid-controversy-and-retain-chair-role-wsj-reports.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stepping down</a> as CEO of The We Company, the parent of WeWork. He’ll remain with the office rental company as non-executive chairman, aka a pilot who doesn’t get to touch the controls. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The main instigator: </strong>Masayoshi Son, CEO of major WeWork investor SoftBank. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Masa was gaga over Neumann as recently as this January, when he </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-wework-m-a-softbank/wework-gets-2-billion-after-softbank-cuts-planned-investment-idUSKCN1P21OH?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plugged $2 billion</a></span><span> into WeWork at a $47 billion valuation.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But WeWork aged as gracefully into fall as the New York Mets</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As it prepared for a monster IPO this summer, WeWork filed regulatory documents that left people who write words for a living “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-08-14/wework-ipo-shows-it-s-the-most-magical-unicorn?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">at a loss for words</a>.” Convoluted financials, incomprehensible corporate governance structures, billions of dollars in losses...it’s all there. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As Masa and other investors watched WeWork <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/13/wework-makes-sweeping-corporate-governance-changes-ahead-of-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slash its valuation</a> from $47 billion to $15 billion to salvage the IPO, their collective blood pressure climbed. When WeWork delayed its public offering last week, they’d had enough. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">First there was Adam, then came We </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Neumann co-founded WeWork in 2010, and with the right mix of charisma, capital, and shrewdness, he turned it into one of the most valuable startups in the country. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Don’t forget how big WeWork is. </strong></span><span>Last September, the company topped JPMorgan to become the </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-property-wework-milestone/wework-tops-jpmorgan-as-no-1-new-york-tenant-as-coworking-booms-idUSKCN1LY34R?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">largest tenant of office space</a></span><span> in Manhattan. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>WeWork has over 800 locations in cities as far-flung as Xi’An, China, and Columbus, Ohio. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/this-is-not-the-way-everybody-behaves-how-adam-neumanns-over-the-top-style-built-wework-11568823827?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unflattering media reports</a> in recent weeks showed that Neumann's eccentric leadership style and cozy financial relationship with the company had turned WeWork’s IPO radioactive on Wall St. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Where does WeWork go from here? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CFO Artie Minson and Vice Chairman Sebastian Gunningham will take over as co-CEOs, but don’t expect them to ring the bell at the Nasdaq this morning. <a href="https://www.theinformation.com/articles/wework-bankers-have-discussed-laying-off-one-third-of-workforce?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Heavy job cuts</a> could be on the horizon, and WeWork has a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/adam-neumanns-ouster-wouldnt-change-wework-equation-11569342629?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">long way to go</a> to resolve its governance, financial, and reputational issues.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
POLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/24/pelosi-announces-impeachment-inquiry-trump?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pelosi Says It’s Go Time
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Pelosi Says It’s Go Time" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY5MzYxMzE5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>MANDEL NGAN/AFP/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Speaker Nancy Pelosi <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/24/us/politics/democrats-impeachment-trump.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced yesterday</a> that the U.S. House of Representatives will begin a formal impeachment investigation into President Trump. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There have been impeachment rumblings in the past. But last week, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/24/democrats-push-for-impeachment-grows-over-trump-ukraine-call.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a> surfaced (courtesy of a whistleblower) that Trump allegedly pressured the president of Ukraine to investigate presidential rival Joe Biden and his son. The accusation that Trump tried to enlist a foreign power for his own political benefit changed the impeachment equation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Markets <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/global-stocks-edge-up-as-central-bankers-diverge-11569313493?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dipped</a> early in the day, then recovered a bit after Trump said he plans to release a transcript of his call with the Ukrainian president today. Still, the S&P had its <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/24/stock-market-us-china-trade-talks-in-focus-on-wall-street.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest one-day drop</a> since August from all the political uncertainty.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Rep. Adam Schiff, chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, <a href="https://twitter.com/RepAdamSchiff/status/1176564220407767042?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Etweet&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a> that the whistleblower intends to testify, possibly as soon as this week.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BIZ LAW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/24/american-firms-escape-europe-two-legal-victories?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Two U.S. Firms Escape Europe With Legal Victories
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Two U.S. Firms Escape Europe With Legal Victories" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY5MzYwNzg1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Westend61/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It won’t make up for the 2018 Ryder Cup, but...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">No. 1: Google</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Europe’s top court <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/24/eu-rules-on-google-right-to-be-forgotten-case.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ruled yesterday</a> that Google doesn’t have to extend the “right to be forgotten” outside the EU. That right = the ability to request that search engines remove personal information that’s outdated, false, or reputationally damaging. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>France’s privacy regulator pushed Google to apply it globally, but Google has said it’s not that easy because the tool lies at the delicate intersection of privacy and freedom of speech. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After years of regulatory probes in Europe, Google’s lawyers are just happy to have gotten a W. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">No. 2: Starbucks</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The court also <a href="https://www.apnews.com/4df9353c98f14763a69fdab56348452c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ruled in Starbucks’s favor</a> yesterday in a tax case. In 2015, the company and the Dutch government got into hot water over a cozy deal the European Commission ruled as illegal state support. The court said there wasn’t proof Starbucks got a leg up.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But...the same court is making Fiat pay Luxembourg ~30 million euros in a similar tax case.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Nike and Ikea are facing </span><span><a href="https://ec.europa.eu/competition/state_aid/tax_rulings/index_en.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ongoing tax investigations</a></span><span> in Europe and probably wondering if they’ll get the Bucks or the boot treatment.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LABOR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/24/us-labor-department-grants-workers-overtime-pay?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
U.S. Labor Department Raises the Roof
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the U.S. Department of Labor <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/24/business/economy/overtime-pay-rule-trump-administration.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> it had finalized a new rule on overtime pay. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it does: </strong>Expands the pool of workers eligible for at least time-and-a-half overtime pay, from those who make under <span>$23,660</span> per year to workers who make less than $35,568 per year.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Because of the new rule, an estimated 1.2 million workers will qualify for overtime. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That’s great, right? </strong>Depends on who you ask. Some labor advocates were disappointed the department didn’t raise the ceiling more. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s hard to accept a Grande when you were offered a Venti.</strong> In 2016, the Obama administration <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/more-workers-to-qualify-for-overtime-pay-11569330000?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tried to jack</a> the salary ceiling up to $47,476. But later that year, a federal judge blocked the move following <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/federal-judge-issues-nationwide-injunction-putting-overtime-pay-regulation-on-hold-1479857762?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">legal challenges</a> from 21 states and over 50 business groups. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Their counter-counterpoint was that Obama’s proposed rule would have been too costly for firms. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Consider this acting Labor Secretary Patrick Pizzella’s parting shot. Yesterday, a Senate committee narrowly voted to advance the nomination of Eugene Scalia to helm the DOL.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F09%2F24%2Fus-labor-department-grants-workers-overtime-pay" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=It%E2%80%99s+hard+to+accept+a+Grande+when+you+were+offered+a+Venti&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/24/us-labor-department-grants-workers-overtime-pay&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F09%2F24%2Fus-labor-department-grants-workers-overtime-pay&title=U.S.+Labor+Department+Grants+More+Workers+Overtime+Pay+&source=www.morningbrew.com&summary=It%E2%80%99s+hard+to+accept+a+Grande+when+you+were+offered+a+Venti" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/24/lyfts-one-app-rule?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Lyft’s One App to Rule Them All
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTA2L3RhYnMtaGVyb180MDJ4X2pwZ19mb3JtYXRfMTUwMHcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Lyft</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Lyft’s a simple company.</strong> All it wants is to destroy personal car ownership, gain on a certain ride-hailing competitor, and serve all your transportation needs. So yesterday, the company released a significant <a href="https://www.citylab.com/transportation/2019/09/lyft-app-real-time-public-transit-train-bus-subway-travel/598702/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">update</a> to its app. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In some North American cities, users can check scooter, bike, car rental, and public transportation options on Lyft’s home screen. It plans to roll out cost and travel time comparisons between transportation modes in the coming weeks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The strategy: </strong>Lyft (-7.57%) knows you check five apps before finding your preferred travel method, but it’s guessing you want to check fewer than that. It also knows how freeing it is to <em>not</em> be in a car. In cities with micromobility options, <a href="https://blog.lyft.com/posts/lyft-multimodal-app?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">every eighth Lyft ride</a> this summer took place on a bike or scooter. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Lyft's a little late to the game. </strong></span><span>Uber </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2018/09/06/uber-makes-it-easier-to-switch-between-rides-scooters-bikes-and-car-rentals/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rolled out</a></span><span> a suite of integrations with alternative transportation options last year. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>By making it easier to choose non-car options, these companies are trying to keep users within their ecosystems and address their impact on <a href="https://www.citylab.com/transportation/2019/08/uber-lyft-traffic-congestion-ride-hailing-cities-drivers-vmt/595393/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">city congestion</a>.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAdam Neumann is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/24/wework-ceo-adam-neumann-is-expected-to-step-down-amid-controversy-and-retain-chair-role-wsj-reports.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estepping down\u003c/a\u003e as CEO of The We Company, the parent of WeWork. He’ll remain with the office rental company as non-executive chairman, aka a pilot who doesn’t get to touch the controls. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe main instigator: \u003c/strong\u003eMasayoshi Son, CEO of major WeWork investor SoftBank. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMasa was gaga over Neumann as recently as this January, when he \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-wework-m-a-softbank/wework-gets-2-billion-after-softbank-cuts-planned-investment-idUSKCN1P21OH?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplugged $2 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e into WeWork at a $47 billion valuation.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut WeWork aged as gracefully into fall as the New York Mets\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs it prepared for a monster IPO this summer, WeWork filed regulatory documents that left people who write words for a living “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-08-14/wework-ipo-shows-it-s-the-most-magical-unicorn?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eat a loss for words\u003c/a\u003e.” Convoluted financials, incomprehensible corporate governance structures, billions of dollars in losses...it’s all there. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs Masa and other investors watched WeWork \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/13/wework-makes-sweeping-corporate-governance-changes-ahead-of-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslash its valuation\u003c/a\u003e from $47 billion to $15 billion to salvage the IPO, their collective blood pressure climbed. When WeWork delayed its public offering last week, they’d had enough. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFirst there was Adam, then came We \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNeumann co-founded WeWork in 2010, and with the right mix of charisma, capital, and shrewdness, he turned it into one of the most valuable startups in the country. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDon’t forget how big WeWork is. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLast September, the company topped JPMorgan to become the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-property-wework-milestone/wework-tops-jpmorgan-as-no-1-new-york-tenant-as-coworking-booms-idUSKCN1LY34R?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elargest tenant of office space\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in Manhattan. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWeWork has over 800 locations in cities as far-flung as Xi’An, China, and Columbus, Ohio. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/this-is-not-the-way-everybody-behaves-how-adam-neumanns-over-the-top-style-built-wework-11568823827?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunflattering media reports\u003c/a\u003e in recent weeks showed that Neumann's eccentric leadership style and cozy financial relationship with the company had turned WeWork’s IPO radioactive on Wall St. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhere does WeWork go from here? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCFO Artie Minson and Vice Chairman Sebastian Gunningham will take over as co-CEOs, but don’t expect them to ring the bell at the Nasdaq this morning. \u003ca href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/wework-bankers-have-discussed-laying-off-one-third-of-workforce?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eHeavy job cuts\u003c/a\u003e could be on the horizon, and WeWork has a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/adam-neumanns-ouster-wouldnt-change-wework-equation-11569342629?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elong way to go\u003c/a\u003e to resolve its governance, financial, and reputational issues.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- In 2015, the company and the Dutch government got into hot water over a cozy deal the European Commission ruled as illegal state support. The court said there wasn’t proof Starbucks got a leg up.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nU.S. Labor Department Raises the Roof\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the U.S. Department of Labor \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/24/business/economy/overtime-pay-rule-trump-administration.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e it had finalized a new rule on overtime pay. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat it does: \u003c/strong\u003eExpands the pool of workers eligible for at least time-and-a-half overtime pay, from those who make under \u003cspan\u003e$23,660\u003c/span\u003e per year to workers who make less than $35,568 per year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBecause of the new rule, an estimated 1.2 million workers will qualify for overtime. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat’s great, right? \u003c/strong\u003eDepends on who you ask. Some labor advocates were disappointed the department didn’t raise the ceiling more. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s hard to accept a Grande when you were offered a Venti.\u003c/strong\u003e In 2016, the Obama administration \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/more-workers-to-qualify-for-overtime-pay-11569330000?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etried to jack\u003c/a\u003e the salary ceiling up to $47,476. But later that year, a federal judge blocked the move following \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/federal-judge-issues-nationwide-injunction-putting-overtime-pay-regulation-on-hold-1479857762?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elegal challenges\u003c/a\u003e from 21 states and over 50 business groups. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTheir counter-counterpoint was that Obama’s proposed rule would have been too costly for firms. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eConsider this acting Labor Secretary Patrick Pizzella’s parting shot.
